alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Denton; Grayson; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 9:24PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wise, northwestern Denton, Cooke and southwestern Grayson Counties through 1000 PM CST... At 924 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Forestburg, or 14 miles northwest of Sanger, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Sanger, Whitesboro, Collinsville, Muenster, Gunter, Lindsay, Callisburg, Dorchester, Ray Roberts Park Johnson Branch, Lake Kiowa, Southmayd, Tioga, Valley View and Sadler. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 479 and 502. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for north central Texas.
